Authors: Felipe Lorenz Simões, Augusto Ferrari, Jocélia Grazia
Title:
Is Elsiella Froeschner, 1981 a valid genus? (Hemiptera:
Heteroptera: Pentatomidae: Pentatominae)
Keywords:
Pentatomini, morphology of genitalia, cladistics,
taxonomy, biogeography
Abstract:
The genus Elsiella Froeschner, 1981 is validated based on
the analysis of a recently found male specimen of E. plana (Walker,
1867). A cladistic analysis comprising a data set of 40 morphological
characters and 22 taxa, including the genera Elsiella, Serdia Stï¿½l,
Similliserdia Fortes & Grazia, Neotibilis Grazia & Barcellos,
and Tibilis Stï¿½l, was performed. Elsiella plana is redescribed and
illustrated. Maps are provided for Elsiella and Serdia with
biogeographical considerations for Serdia.
